html:
Feb 17 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.


- Alta Fox Capital Management LLC is seeking to add several directors to Hasbro Inc's HAS.O board and is urging the toy maker to make changes including a spinoff of its fast-growing unit housing games such as Dungeons & Dragons. https://on.wsj.com/355yT1S


- Activist investor Daniel Loeb, whose Third Point LLC counts Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O as one of its biggest holdings, told investors on Wednesday that he sees roughly $1 trillion in untapped value at the e-commerce giant. https://on.wsj.com/3rUfidO


- Canadian police on Wednesday gave hundreds of protesters written warnings to leave their encampment in the capital's downtown, a final move aimed at avoiding a major and potentially damaging confrontation after 20 days of vehicle blockades and demonstrations against Covid-19 vaccine mandates. https://on.wsj.com/3BpSOoa


- Steve Dickson, administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration, is resigning as the top U.S. air-safety regulator, the agency said late Wednesday. https://on.wsj.com/3HZa9qC


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))
